verses.roman:
tena deva-gaṇāḥ sarve
vṛtra-visphoṭanena vai
nipetur mūrcchitā bhūmau
yathaivāśaninā hatāḥ

synonyms: tena—by that; deva-gaṇāḥ—the demigods; sarve—all; vṛtra-visphoṭanena—the tumultuous sound of Vṛtrāsura; vai—indeed; nipetuḥ—fell; mūrcchitāḥ—fainted; bhūmau—on the ground; yathā—just as if; eva—indeed; aśaninā—by a thunderbolt; hatāḥ—struck.
translation: When all the demigods heard Vṛtrāsura's tumultuous roar, which resembled that of a lion, they fainted and fell to the ground as if struck by thunderbolts.
